alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cochise County through 715 PM MST... At 630 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bowie, or 22 miles east of Willcox, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bowie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 347 and 377. Route 186 between mile markers 341 and 355. Route 191 between mile markers 88 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
